They give you 4 slices of pita bread and  a little cup of yogurt type dipping sauce.  Great flavors all around!  The only thing I didn't touch was the salad.  It was getting a bit wilted (drive back to work with hot items in the container...probably should have been separate from the hot items) and I tossed it out.  Everything else was fanfreakingtastic though!  Service was very friendly, and I appreciated the hookup of the lunch price even though it was a few minutes past the time frame.  The food did take a little while to come out, but it was definitely hot and fresh, so it was worth the wait.  I may call in a to go order next time though.  I'm sure I will be back in due time!  It was a great lunch!

I stopped by Good Fellas Grill last night after reading all the reviews on Yelp.  I was not disappointed at all.  Ninos is a dynamic restaurant owner - offering everything you'd want in a local hole-in-the-wall restaurant.  He makes you feel instantly welcome with his warm smile and friendly disposition.  I kept thinking about who he reminded me of and it came to me this morning - the Cake Boss.  lol  While I waited for my meal to be prepared, he brought me some delicious potato chicken curry soup.  It was piping hot, wonderfully spicy, and the perfect way to begin the meal.  I ordered the hummus appetizer and the two-meat platter.  Everything was perfect.  The hummus was perfectly seasoned, creamy and rich with garlic.  The pita bread served with it was warm, fresh, and plentiful.  My two-meat platter was tasty, too.  The chicken was tender and juicy (which is difficult to do with chicken breast) and the seasoned ground beef kabab was also very good.  I also enjoyed the mountain of rice - which was basmati (or maybe jasmine).  It was fragrant, light, and fantastic.  I couldn't pass up on the little pistachio bird nest pastries by the register, so bought four of them to take home for later.  Like everything else, they were delicious - so buttery and bursting with yummy goodness.  My boyfriend is a vegetarian and I noticed they had nearly a dozen vegetarian selections including a veggie platter, falafel, hummus, lentil soup, and much, much more.  I can't wait to go back to try a different selection from their vast menu.  With most of their selections under $10 (some even at $7.99), it's affordable enough to make a regular stop.

Possibly one of the most spacious Mediterranean places I've ever been!! The decor is contemporary, it's clean and well kept. When you first walk in, it's confusing as to whether or not it's a sit down and order type of place. You don't though, you order at the counter and then sit. You get a bowl of complimentary soup in either lentil or chicken and rice. They bring your food to your table for you.   We both got the vegetarian platter, which I thought were amazing. Darrin thought that the falafel didn't have as much flavor as most other places we go, but I thought they were perfect!!! I also think most other places falafel is overly salty! You also get hummus, baba ghanouj, salad, and two other things that I can't remember what they were called... They were delicious though!!!   The staff were very polite and answered all of our questions for us as well as some suggestions if you don't know what you want.   We will definitely be back again!!

Definitely Good Fellas here!  I came in 30 mins before closing to pick up my order via Yelp. It was rainy and dark outside so the restaurant was empty. They offered me a soup on the house, I got the potato and chicken. Potato nice and soggy (just the way I like it in soup!) and chicken was super tasty. I actually don't normally like chicken but this chicken was seasoned very well!  For appetizer I got hummus + pita bread. Yelp seemed to rave about their hummus. I thought it was OK. I wanted it to be a little more lemon-y. The bread was standard pita, nothing to really rave about.  For the meal I got the 3 meat plate that came with a beef kabob, grilled chicken skewer and a steak skewer. I really liked the chicken and steak. Chicken wasn't dry and well seasoned so that was a big plus! Steak is steak... It was flavored just enough that you can still taste that delicious beefiness of steak. Loved it! The beef kabob was a little disappointing. I didn't think the seasoning went too well with it, but with some of that garlic spread, it tasted alright. The rice was a little over cooked for me. A tad too soggy.  Ordered a Baklava on the spot as well. To my surprise it was a pistachio one! I super regretted not getting 2 additional pieces! It was delicious and they gave me my 1 piece on the house as well! I wished the top layers could've been a little more crunchy rather than soggy (from all the honey) but this was the highlight of my meal. LOVED it!  4 star mainly boosted by the amazing/friendly service!   TIP: order directly rather than through yelp for faster pick-up.

This is a great place to get a healthy, tasty meal. It's not my favorite place for Mediterranean food, but it's close to work, the portions are good and she gives you a free bowl of soup while you wait for your food, which is nice. And I can tell the soup is a healthy addition and it's good (lentil).  I can't give it a higher scores because for me the hummus is good, but everybody makes their hummus different and while I like their hummus, I've had better at a few places (or maybe I'm just spoiled by my own hummus fusion - with cilantro and jalapeños). I also prefer basmati rice but I know that rice is super expensive now, so I don't blame a restaurant for not using it.  So it's a nice place to get a healthy, tasty meal.

The stars don't lie! We came here for the first time today and let me start off by saying the food was very delicious. We had the chicken lettuce wraps, two meat combo, gyro sandwich and a piece of their baklava yumm! In addition to their delicious food their staff is very friendly. Nino's (I hope I'm not misspelling his name :/ lol) hospitality was amazing he checked up on us to make sure everything was good and at the end of our meal he came up and introduced himself. We will definitely be coming back!

Absolutely fantastic food and service. I accidentally found this place when stopping by Chino's for lunch. The complimentary chicken and potato curry soup was fantastic. I don't even like soup but I finished it all. I love gyro sandwiches and this place does them better than most I've had in town.   The service, as good as it gets. I went in and got more than I expected to for less money than I expected to spend. You can tell this place really wants the business and treats you like they do. I was surprised and impressed. I will be back.
Kefta, hummus, falafel, baklava, rice, complimentary soup all yum.      Will definitely come back.

Holy friggin crap this food is amazing!  The guy at front counter was super nice and talked the food up for sure but when we actually got it he was not BSing us at all.  I am glad I know about this place now.  I will be a frequent flyer here!  The lunch special is unbeatable.  I promise you can't get fast food at this price that is this healthy.

Came in last week and got the lunch combo 3 meat plate and omg it was so good. The chicken was so flavorful and juicy. i do wish they would add more pieces of chicken. The rice was evenly cooked. The salad was ok I was more focused on the meat. The free soup I got the lentil was so good! And freeeee. Can't wait to come back. I would suggest to order ahead cuz it does take a long time for them to make the food.

I wnt back to Good Fellas and again had that Chicken Kabobs over rice.  The rice was perfect this time and the chicken was bursting with flavor and juicy.  The service was great, this has been my experience a majority of the team,  Thank you Ninos and team,  keep it up.

Excellent world-class food service in a unassuming location; if you want a meal Worth the drive and the money,this is where your car will take you.   Very,Very nice staff and the food is Delicious-WOW.

I've recently had an obsession with Mediterranean food so trying this place out(since it had so many great reviews) was a no brainer. And let me tell you I was not disappointed. The food is fresh, delicious, and affordable. They have a 5.99 3 meat lunch special with gyro meat, chicken and khafta.
Excellent ! First time there and already planning my next visit . Grilled to perfection, DELICIOUS !

Best darn Mediterranean food I've had in a long time. My favorite is the Chicken Kabob's and also a Fatoosh salad . I mix the salad with the rice and chicken and the combination is so amazing . I make a similar salad at home , it's so addicting that I highly recommend trying the two together. My husband loves the lettuce wraps , I don't know why but it reminds me of tacos, I like this too , but I feel incomplete if I don't order my usual.

I've only been here once. It's in a strip mall next to Chino Bandido.  Hands down best gyro I've had in the Phoenix area.  I've been to many Greek restaurants all over town.  It was on a fresh warm/toasted pita with well seasoned good quality meat, combo price was $7.99. No comments on the rest of the menu items. I'll be back for more gyros and to try other items!

I cannot say enough about this place, it is as good or better than most Greek places I have been to costing 2x as much, the soups were outstanding as were the kafta and chicken kabobs.  The gyro plate was very good as well. The staff was friendly enough to make you feel you were in their own home.

the lunch special is delicious 3 meat rice And salad for 6 dollars! the meat is juicy and seasoned perfectly! Ninos and his family are very nice and make it easy to contribute to local small business dining options!!  the kabob hindy and the fish are tasty and delicious! their gyros are good too if u want something familiar and quick. great hummus as well

The man at the register (Nino's) I hope I spelt his name correctly was extremely humble and outgoing. He had a smile on his face and really made me feel comfortable and excited to eat at the establishment. The food was banging too! I got the number 7 (Two meat combo) and would recommend it!

We were overnighting in Phoenix. We were tired and just wanted some cheap eats. We found this modest place in a strip mall. We were surprised that a free bowl of soup comes with each order. This night there was a choice between the lentil soup - their standard offering - and potato soup. We opted for lentil, which was delicious, but our waitress - the owner's niece insisted on giving us a bowl of soup also, saying, "The potato soup is bomb - you may try it. It was amazing. I had the spanakopita; my wife the Greek teriyaki chicken. Both were delicious. Our total bill came to $18. Incredible value.
This is a fantastic hole in the wall place to eat. Check it out. The owners are gems and the food is great.

What an unexpected treat.  We didn't know what to expect.  It's located in a strip mall and both the outside and inside didn't appear impressive but my wife and I both had Shawarma combos that were massive and probably the most flavorful Greek wraps we've ever had.  The portions were huge too.  The family and staff that ran it were super friendly and provided excellent service.  We will definitely come back.
